summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackMelt away makeup and impurities with the Good Molecules nourishing Instant Cleansing Balm that rinses without greasy residue.
details: DetailsBenefitsSea buckthorn oil, camellia oil, and shea butter ensure skin retains its essential moisture.Rinses away with just water, leaving skin comfortably clean.Melts on contact with skin to dissolve makeup, dirt and other impurities.Item 2582315How To UseScoop out a generous amount with the enclosed spatula and massage into dry skin. Rinse with water or wipe away with a damp cloth. Suitable for daily use. Discontinue use if irritation occurs.IngredientsEthylhexyl Palmitate, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Synthetic Wax, PEG-8 Isostearate, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, 1,2-Hexanediol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Camellia Oleifera Seed Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Hippophae Rhamnoides Oil.
how_to_use: Scoop out a generous amount with the enclosed spatula and massage into dry skin. Rinse with water or wipe away with a damp cloth. Suitable for daily use. Discontinue use if irritation occurs.

reviews.headline: it does the work
reviews.comments:
i did like it, it melts once you apply on skin
i liked the price is not that expensive and it does the job !

reviews.headline: I keep coming back to this one
reviews.comments: I've tried other balms but this one is the best. Removes makeup super easily, rinses off without residue, no weird smells. I also love the tiny spatula and that it comes in a recyclable tin. Lasts me a few months but also wish it could be larger.

reviews.headline: Clogs pores
reviews.comments: Does the job of removing makeup but caused under the skin acne

reviews.headline: Love it!!
reviews.comments: I love this cleansing balm. I usually use the Elf one but decided to try this one bc I love the brand and I feel like it removed my makeup faster and my face didn't feel greasy after I wiped it off

reviews.headline: Best Double Cleanser!
reviews.comments:
I use this go help get off sunscreen and daily grime at night (I rarely wear makeup but it's done well when i have!)
A little bit is really effective - a jar lasts me 6-8weeks. 
I can really feel it clearing things off, and even feel it cleansing my pores and removing some clogging! Follow it up with a gel cleanser and feel so so clean

A little bit is really effective - a jar lasts me 6-8weeks.

reviews.headline: Amazing!
reviews.comments: I was so pleasantly surprised at how well this worked.  It even took off all of the mascara residue and helped to start off my double cleanse the right way.  My face felt so sumptuous afterwards.  Loved it!
I love this product. I've been wanting to try it for a while. Feels amazing when getting make up off.

reviews.headline: Causes breakouts
reviews.comments: I've been using this product for about a month and noticing my forehead and chin breaking out which I never get I use this and cleanse with panoxyl afterwards my skin was perfect before using this :(

reviews.headline: Have gone through 3 of these
reviews.comments: It takes off my makeup nicely. I love using it before my foaming cleanser

reviews.headline: Bought on Repeat
reviews.comments: Gentle balm takes all my makeup and sunscreen off, including mascara and hard-to-remove sunscreen. I have purchased 11 times and counting. Affordable and easy to use. Not greasy like Elemis Cleansing Balm.

reviews.headline: Worth buying
reviews.comments: The good molecules instant cleansing balm is so smooth and cleans makeup of the face very easily as well as moisturizes your skin. I noticed that the dry skin on my face is no longer a problem. Highly recommend.

reviews.headline: Great!
reviews.comments: After searching for a cruelty free replacement for my favorite makeup remover I found this and havent looked back!! A little goes a log way, it doesnt burn if you happen to get a little in your eyes, it takes off waterproof mascara easily with little effort. Definitely worth trying!!

reviews.headline: Great price but not completely sold
reviews.comments: I purchased this to double cleanser along with the gel cleanser. I don't feel it completely removed everything and it does burn my eyes not sure which cleanser is doing so. No improvement so of youre looking for something that will change your skin the serums do so more than the cleanser.

reviews.headline: Great price but not completely sold
reviews.comments: I purchased this to double cleanser along with the gel cleanser. I don't feel it completely removed everything and it does burn my eyes not sure which cleanser is doing so. No improvement so of youre looking for something that will change your skin the serums do so more than the cleanser.

reviews.headline: Ingredients
reviews.comments: Ethylhexil palmitate is the number one ingredient in this cleansing balm - and is a super pore clogging, breakout making ingredient. Avoid! It might be the reason your skin isn't doing too well. I love good molecules, but this is a no from me.

reviews.headline: Ingredients
reviews.comments: Ethylhexil palmitate is the number one ingredient in this cleansing balm - and is a super pore clogging, breakout making ingredient. Avoid! It might be the reason your skin isn't doing too well. I love good molecules, but this is a no from me.

reviews.headline: Great
reviews.comments: As a removing makeup balm, it's great. It can be hard to switch from using wipes, but this makes it easy to adapt to. I can get most of the makeup off, but I always use a cleanser after and that gets the rest off. A little goes a long way and it lasts for a while.

reviews.headline: Disappointing
reviews.comments: I love this brand but not this product. It took multiple washes to remove my makeup, waterproof or not. This also left an uncomfortable residue. However, as a oil cleanser this could def do the job.

reviews.headline: Obsessed!
reviews.comments: This cleansing balm is one of my all-time favorites! It is very gentle on my sensitive skin and removes every residue of make up!

media.headline: My first step in my double-cleanse
media.caption: Instant Cleansing Balm

faceoff_positive.comments:
I usually have to hunt for a polyethylene & cruelty-free cleansing balm, so when I saw Good Molecules released one, I hit the "add to cart" button immediately! They have become one of my favorite brands lately, anyway on to the review!
The packaging doesn't take up much room, is easy to use, and recyclable. I could easily find myself reusing the little tin after it is emptied. 
The product has zero scent. Like, none whatsoever. If you are sensitive to fragrance, this is the balm for you. 
The texture is really nice. Not too hard to scoop, but not too soft, and it melts with body heat easily. 
I have yet to find a makeup product this doesn't remove. Sunscreen, foundation, concealer, waterproof eyeliner, mascara, even super saturated eyeshadow & liquid lipstick. GONE! It takes a little bit of massaging of course (I find that part relaxing honestly) but I've definitely used far less effective balms before. 
I'd say a full face of makeup takes me about 20 seconds of massaging to remove, and another 10 seconds to rinse off. 
I like using the included spatula/scoop thing, and I only ever need to use a blob about an inch long for a full face of makeup. The whole tub lasts me about a month, and I use it 5 times a week.
This balm emulsifies easily into a milky looking liquid and rinses off quickly. 
If you aren't familiar with cleansing balms, you are supposed to follow them with a second cleanser, but you could possibly get away with using this alone in a pinch because it doesn't seem to leave any greasy residue behind, but I always follow it with a water based cleanser like it is intended to be used, so I'm not positive how great that would be.
Honestly the one flaw is sometimes it is tricky to close the tin completely. Usually I can't be bothered to screw the top on tightly, so I just put the plastic cover on over the product, and place the  aluminum top on loosely. Unless you are literally packing it up and taking it with you every single time you use it, I don't really see that being an issue.

TLDR: If you are looking for a low-waste, cruelty-free, fragrance-free, and very effective cleansing balm, this is the best!
faceoff_positive.headline: My favorite cleansing balm!

faceoff_negative.comments: I will not buy this again. I bought it for double cleansing, along with my regular cleanser, from a different brand. I was going to buy a more expensive cleansing balm that specifically removes waterproof makeup, but I fed into the reviews on this one. I'm going to assume now that none of the reviewers tried this on waterproof mascara or liquid/gel eyeliner, because it DOES NOT work on those - not even a little bit. So I ended up doing what I was trying to avoid - use an actual makeup remover then double cleansing. Aside from that issue this cleansing balm works fine for double cleansing (with another cleanser that's not from GM). But because of that, I will never buy this again since it doesn't work on waterproof makeup. Saying that, all of Good Molecules' cleansing products are woefully incapable of a proper cleanse or doing what they say. I say that as a faithful customer of GM - I use several of their treatments and serums and have done so for the past couple of years. But all of their cleansing products fall short every time I try one. Everything else is great.
faceoff_negative.headline: Does not remove waterproof mascara or liquid/gel eyeliner.
